meta.title: Home - Rosemount-Apple Valley-Eagan ISD 196

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout home fsHasTheme2

li.a: Bilingual and Multilingual Seals and Certificates

div.a: Skip To Main Content
Skip to Main Content

div.br:
We are nationally recognized for providing boundless opportunities in which students can learn and grow. Our work is grounded in our "Triple-A" philosophy of academics, arts and athletics.
Enroll today!

img.alt: A young elementary students sits at a table and smiles.
Three female students in hijabs and a District 196 staff member smile for a photo in a library.

li.a: Bilingual and Multilingual Seals and Certificates

img.alt: Lisa Turgeon explains a Native American artifact to a child.
Superintendent Mary Kreger works with a teacher and student.

div.class: fsElement fsResourceElement fsSlideshow universal-slideshow fsSlideshowHorizontal fsStatePlaying

img.alt: A mother works with her daughter on homework at a computer.

figcaption.h2: Distance learning extended through the end of the year
figcaption.p: All cocurricular activities, including any on-site events that were scheduled, are also canceled. Options for graduations are being discussed, but no decisions have been made.

img.alt: A woman's hands typing on a laptop.

figcaption.p: In response to an executive order by Governor Walz, Elementary and secondary distance learning will be implemented for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. The plans provide unique and engaging educational opportunities for students.

figcaption.h2: Turf field projects move forward at Eagan and Rosemount high schools
figcaption.p: The District 196 School Board approved financing for construction of a stadium and practice field at both schools. Fields are expected to be ready in time for fall sports.

img.alt: District 196 student holds award from the TV production awards

figcaption.h2: Apple Valley and Eastview students fill virtual red carpet during video awards ceremony
figcaption.p: Students earned 13 of 21 awards from the Student Production Awards, sponsored by the Upper Midwest Chapter of the National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences.

figcaption.h2: District 196 adds texting as an option for communication
figcaption.p: Parent/guardians can now choose to receive text messages about important updates, weather cancellations or delays and school reminders by texting "Y" to 67587.

div.p: We are nationally recognized for providing boundless opportunities in which students can learn and grow. At District 196, the sky's the limit.
Our graduates scored nearly two points higher than the nation-leading Minnesota average on the ACT college admissions test.
Our graduation rate exceeds the state average by 10 points.

We are the 4th largest district in Minnesota, serving learners from the cities of Rosemount, Apple Valley, Eagan, Burnsville, Coates, Lakeville and Inver Grove Heights, and Empire and Vermillion townships.
Our high-quality, diverse workforce includes 2,100 licensed teachers and administrators, of which more than half of whom hold master’s or specialist’s degrees.
Sharing stories of Academic, Art and Athletic successes from around the District.

div.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsList home-posts fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailLarge fsItemCount_15

div.a: Distance learning extended through the end of the school year

div.p: All cocurricular activities and on-site events are also canceled. Alternate plans for graduation are currently being discussed.

div.a: District 196 board approves financing and bids for first artificial turf fields

div.p: Eagan and Rosemount are the first two of four artificial turf projects that will be completed over the next 16 months.

img.alt: Apple Valley High School students Hunter Bertram holds trophies at the 2019 Student Production Awards ceremony.

div.a: District 196 high school students win 13 of 21 video production awards

div.p: The Student Production Awards are sponsored by the Upper Midwest Chapter of the National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences.

div.a: District to resume use of Zoom videoconferencing platform

div.p: Based on the addition of new safety and security improvements, the benefit of key features and our familiarity with the system, the district has decided to continue using Zoom.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-7 fsCategory-86 fsTag-27 fsTag-28 fsTag-29 fsTag-96

div.a: District 196 board ready to approve financing for artificial turf fields

div.p: Bids for the certificates of participation will be opened the morning of April 13 and results will be presented at the board meeting that night.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-7 fsCategory-86 fsTag-28 fsTag-116 fsTag-126

img.alt: Diffley Road with an illuminated school zone sign during morning traffic.

div.a: District 196 supports bonding request to fund Diffley Road improvements

div.p: Dakota County’s request is for $4.62 million to fund several proposed pedestrian and vehicle safety improvements on Diffley Road, Braddock Trail and the adjacent campuses.

div.a: School Board special meeting scheduled for April 6

div.p: This meeting is not at the regular location and will be held virtually. Topics include certificates of participation pre-sale report for financing turf fields and bonding request for safety improvements at Diffley Road and Braddock Trail.

div.a: Thank you, District 196 community!
District 196 Budget Advisory Council has open positions for residents and staff

div.p: The purpose of the BAC is to ensure active community participation in and enhanced community understanding of the district’s budget planning process, and to provide input on budget plans that support district goals, policies and initiatives.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-7 fsCategory-2 fsTag-27 fsTag-28 fsTag-29 fsTag-96

div.a: Sixteen District 196 seniors named National Merit Scholarship finalists

div.p: All 16 District 196 seniors who were selected semifinalists last fall have been named finalists and are eligible for the approximately 7,600 merit scholarships totaling more than $31 million that will be awarded this spring.

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-7 fsCategory-2 fsTag-28 fsTag-29 fsTag-96

div.a: District 196 students earned top finishes at state business competitions

div.p: Twelve District 196 high school students had top finishes at state business competitions in early March to qualify for national competitions that were scheduled for this spring but have been canceled.

div.a: Schoology and Seesaw connectivity issues

div.p: The national Schoology and Seesaw support teams are monitoring the situation and working hard to minimize any disruptions to service to member districts.

div.a: Distance learning begins Monday, March 30

div.p: We are committed to the goal of providing meaningful learning opportunities and personalized connections between students/families and teachers/school staff during this time.

img.alt: A bag of lunch that includes a sandwich and apple.

div.a: Free grab-and-go meal distribution resumes March 30

div.p: Free meals will be available at five school locations or dropped off at neighborhood sites around District 196.

div.a: March 19 message from Superintendent Kreger

div.p: Transcript of Superintendent Mary Kreger's latest update to families regarding COVID-19.

section.class: fsElement fsCalendar fsSlideshow home-events fsItemCount_25 fsSlideshowHorizontal

div.div: Dakota Ridge School 4629 144th Street West, Apple Valley, MN
